message: You guys know where I might find Arduino supplies? :)
Either MicroCenter or Fry's. Both are north of town, up I-85.
Thanks for the answers guys, but I don't have time to go so far up north. I'll just order online :) What have you guys been hacking in Arduino?
Do they have Arduino stuff at either of those places?  I have always just ordered online.  I am pretty sure MicroCenter doesn't have any.  Maybe Fry's since it does have electronics parts.
I haven't done a lot.  I have used it to gather digital and analog input data over USB at work and have an unfinished heated glove temperature controller at home.
I ported the PyMite VM to the Arduino Mega; in face I'm busy debugging a heap-alignment issue on the AM at the moment.  pythononachip.org
@dwhall: Nice! Will it work on Uno?
@gudbergur: Sorry, no.  Arduino/AVRs need at least 8K currently; or 4K when I get the next release out later this year.
